thread.title: Etihad Airways says no to RwandAir - for right now
thread.title_full: Etihad Airways says no to RwandAir - for right now

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Etihad Airways says no to RwandAir - for right now
text:
Etihad Airways says no to RwandAir - for right now   
Aug 11, 2015 Banners   
Yesterday eTN reported about RwandAirâ€™s CEO, John Mirenge, saying that the airline was in discussions about equity participation with Star Alliance member, Ethiopian Airlines. He also threw the name of Etihad Airways into the ring when he singled out the national airline of the UAE as a second discussion partner. 
Today, an Etihad Airways spokesperson told eTurboNews that Etihad Airways had not expressed an interest in investing in RwandAir and is not in talks to do so. 
The spokesperson for the Abu Dhabibased airline explained: "Etihad Airways confirms that it has declined any offer of a potential investment in RwandAir, the national airline of Rwanda. 
"Etihad Airways is, however, constantly fostering and developing commercial relationships with airlines around the world, including RwandAir, in order to offer its guests a wider choice of travel options."
